instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A1369: What is A1369? A1369 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Air from years Late 2010, Mid 2011 with EMC 2392, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-2838, 820-3023..
definitions.U6100: What is U6100? this is an SPI ROM chip that holds the BIOS which is necessary for the machine to POST or try and power on..
definitions.820-3023: What is 820-3023? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1369</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> have 3 beeps how to diagnose?
threads.message:
Hi I am new to this forum.  I am from the Netherlands, and a very newbee in repairing on motherboard level.
This is my problem I have three beeps on startup and no screen.
I have already reflow the memory  modules,  without success
Is there a way to find out which memory module is may be faulty or needs to be reballed before reballing all of them ?

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1369</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> have 3 beeps how to diagnose?
threads.message:
First of all, welcome to the forum!

Reballing is not a definitive solution.
You should change all RAM chips.
Be aware, the problem can be also caused by CPU, or its broken traces/solders.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1369</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> have 3 beeps how to diagnose?
threads.message: In general on <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1369</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> it's not the RAM itself. 2010 is probably MCP, 2011 is more likely CPU or bad pad/trace. No definitive solution to this.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1369</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> have 3 beeps how to diagnose?
threads.message: I found some liquid damage on the <CHIP>U6100</CHIP>, also on pin8 of the <CHIP>U3690</CHIP> and some green corrosion on testpoint tp[1] <SIGNAL>DP_A_BIAS</SIGNAL> could this be the problem?

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1369</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> have 3 beeps how to diagnose?
threads.message: What is the 820-xxxx code of your board?

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1369</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> have 3 beeps how to diagnose?
threads.message: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3023</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1369</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> have 3 beeps how to diagnose?
threads.message:
<CHIP>U3690</CHIP> is far away of RAM and CPU areas.

You can have bad RAM chip, or CPU.
Can also be broken trace/solder under CPU, or RAM chip.

Just in case, heat CPU to 180-200 degress, for 15-20s.
Use quality flux; no need to melt the balls, just to burn eventually accumulated crap between them.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1369</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> have 3 beeps how to diagnose?
threads.message: Ok i will try that now

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1369</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> have 3 beeps how to diagnose?
threads.message: Do i need to remove the glue at the corners of the CPU?

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1369</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> have 3 beeps how to diagnose?
threads.message:
I have heaten the CPU according your advice, but no luck.  It is still beeping 3 times. 
Is there a way to measure which RAM is defective?.
Or do I have to measure something else before start replacing the RAM modules.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1369</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> have 3 beeps how to diagnose?
threads.message:
No way to detect a failing RAM chip.
You can change them all, but be aware about CPU issue (maybe not RAM).

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1369</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> have 3 beeps how to diagnose?
threads.message: ok tanks for your help for now

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1369</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> have 3 beeps how to diagnose?
threads.message: One morething suggestion where to buy those RAM modules

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1369</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> have 3 beeps how to diagnose?
threads.message:
You can try to remove from scrap board.
Pray the scrap board wasn't discarded for the same problem...

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1369</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> have 3 beeps how to diagnose?
threads.message: I do not have scrap boards do you know where to buy?

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1369</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> have 3 beeps how to diagnose?
threads.message: Aliexpress is the best place for scrap boards.
